title: Cookies erased on FF for iOS
content:
Hi,

I am pretty mad at the iOS team since the latest release came out. I use Firefox for iOS for a long time now and the latest version has the most annoying bug I have ever encountered on a browser: it erases all of my cookies. FF 142.0.1 on iOS 18 first did this last Friday, when the loading of a web page was slowed down because of a network issue. When it resumed, my connexion to the website’s session was lost because the cookie was gone too. But it not only erased this website’s cookie, it erased ALL of the cookies contained in FF. Which is fucking annoying. And it did it again ten minutes ago, without any reason. I would also like to mention that the browsing is quite slow and the app tends to freeze way faster than before. It’s not the first time FF upsets me because of bugs, but such a mismanagement of something as fundamental as a cookie is not acceptable and I would very much like this bug to get fixed quite promptly. Thank you for your attention.
creator: gary.dagorn

title: Change to tab display in 142.0.1, taking up too much space
content:
Before I updated to 142.0.1 when I had a tab group and closed it by clicking on it, all the tabs collapsed into the tab group tab and the only thing I could see was the tab group title tab. This was awesome! I started using it immediately and loved it. Since I updated the tab groups still work, but now, sometimes, when I click on the tab group tab to close the group I see the title tab, one of the tabs included in the group, and a "+2" or however many tabs are hidden. This pretty much defeats the whole idea of having the tab groups in the first place, which to me, was to hide ALL THE TABS under ONE tab to clean up my work area.

The image below shows an example. Note the "eBay" tab group is closed, and yet it shows the tab group tab (eBay), a tab in that group (eBay icon and "Order" with the X to close the tab), and then "+2" meaning there are two hidden tabs. In contrast, the "Simple" and "Web Work" tab groups are also closed and contain 4 and 9 tabs respectively, all neatly tucked under the one tag group tab for each group.

Why is this happening only on some tab groups, and only some of the time? How can I stop this from happening?

title: How do I avoid pre-translated sites ?
content: Hello, I'm bilingual French/English. I browse in French, 90 % of the time (Using Firefox and DuckDuckGo). Unfortunately, more and more often, search results bring up sites which are obviously produced by AI sources for an English-speaking audience then automatically translated into French., which isn't what I'm looking for. For instance, If I look for some information on a medical condition, I get tons of answers from unknown and dubious sources and the content is very obviously Ai-related and translated into French. It's as if all the trustworthy sites (in English or French language) I used to easily access have been downgraded and sent to the bottom of the web never to be accessed again. This is really frightening. Any clues how to avoid this, or are we now locked against our will into the AI grasp ?

Jejda! Stránku nemůžeme najít

Pokud jste se sem dostali tak, že jste na jiném webu klepli na odkaz na rozšíření či motiv vzhledu, není už daný doplněk k dispozici. Příčiny mohou být tyto: 

   Vývojář ho odstranil. Vývojáři to obvykle dělají proto, že již dané rozšíření či motiv vzhledu nepodporují, nebo ho nahradili jiným.    Mozilla ho odstranila. To se může stát tehdy, když byl během kontroly rozšíření či motivu vzhledu objeven problém, nebo když rozšíření či motiv vzhledu porušuje pravidla a podmínky webu addons.mozilla.org. Vývojář má možnost tyto problémy vyřešit a doplněk znovu zpřístupnit.

Zkuste stránku navštívit později, protože motiv vzhledu či rozšíření může být dáno opět k dispozici. Případně můžete to, co hledáte, zkusit najít v jednom z dostupných rozšíření či motivů vzhledu nebo se můžete zeptat v našem komunitním fóru.

creator: marlboro1342

title: Unable to disable restore from crash on Firefox
content:
I'm on Linux and have been using Firefox since I switched over. The first thing I disabled was restoring tabs because I never need it/find it annoying. I noticed that every time I would restart my computer with Firefox open it would restore the session. I understand that this happens because Firefox sees it as a crash so I changed the following settings:

  • browser.sessionstore.resume_from_crash from `true` to `false`
  • browser.sessionstore.max_windows_undo from `5` to `0`
  • browser.sessionstore.max_tabs_undo from `25` to `0`
  • browser.sessionstore.max_resumed_crashes from `1` to `0`

I changed those according to this guide: https://kb.mozillazine.org/Session_Restore#Completely_disabling_session_store

Unfortunately any time I restart my computer with Firefox open it resumes my session. Is there any other way to turn this off? Theres no way all of these settings do nothing.

I also deleted the contents of sessionstore-backups in the profile folder but it just recreates the files after a while.

My goal is to be able to restart and shutdown with Firefox open and not have to worry about it restoring tabs.
creator: elcalzado
